title: Lily Pond
author: Rose Thorogood

description.summary: A contemplative web design incorporating zen-inspired elements with a vertical typographic arrangement, creating a balance between ethereal illustrations and structured information sections.
description.visual_style: Eastern-influenced digital design that combines organic flowing elements with structured typographic layout, using color-blocked sections to create visual rhythm.
description.emotional_impact: Serene yet invigorating atmosphere through the contrast of deep purples, blues and light accents, evoking a sense of enlightenment and creative potential.
description.compositional_elements: Divided into vertical columns with color-coded sections that create distinct informational zones while lotus flower illustrations and fluid lines soften the structured layout.

artistic_context.style_influences: Japanese zen aesthetics, Web 2.0 design principles, digital minimalism, art nouveau organic flourishes
artistic_context.aesthetic_period: Early 2000s web design with contemporary eastern philosophical visual elements
artistic_context.visual_metaphors: Garden path as journey to enlightenment, lotus flowers representing purity of design, flowing water suggesting adaptability

visual_characteristics: Vertical typographic treatment with dramatic scaling
Fluid illustrated elements (lotus flowers, water shapes)
Tripartite color scheme (purple, blue, teal accents)
Balanced asymmetry between text and white space
